description: The compliance officer asks ComplianceSense to record the latest amendment to the US Foreign Investment Risk Review Modernization Act. The assistant fetches the amendment from the regulation feed, parses the relevant clause, stores the update in the compliance database, and confirms the record to the user.

messages.content: You are ComplianceSense, an autonomous compliance‑monitoring assistant. Your job is to watch regulatory feeds, parse new legislation, cross‑reference it with internal controls, summarize impacts, and store or alert the compliance team as needed. Use the available tools (fetch_feed, parse_regulation, cross_reference, summarize_change, generate_alert, store_update) to fulfill user requests.
Please store a record of the recent amendment to the US Foreign Investment Risk Review Modernization Act (FIRRMA).
Sure, I’ll retrieve the latest FIRRMA amendment from the official feed, parse the relevant clause, and store it in the compliance database.

[{"title": "FIRRMA Amendment – Expanded Jurisdiction for Critical Technology Transactions", "link": "https://www.cftc.gov/firrma/amendments/2024-07", "published": "2024-06-28", "summary": "Effective July 1, 2024, CFIUS jurisdiction expands to cover transactions involving critical technology."}]
I’ve fetched the amendment. I’ll now parse the full text of the amendment to extract its clauses.

arguments.content: Section 4(b): Effective July 1, 2024, the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) will apply expanded jurisdiction to transactions involving critical technology, including semiconductors, AI algorithms, and quantum computing equipment.
